newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Dairy Farm signs Indonesia drugstore deal.
newsitem.headline: Dairy Farm signs Indonesia drugstore deal.

text.p: Dairy Farm International Holdings Ltd said on Thursday it has signed a technical aid and management agreement with a 20-unit drugstore chain owned by Indonesia's Rajawali Group.
The Guardian chain, brings to three the number of strategic partnerships signed by Dairy Farm in the last three months to develop a pan-Asia drugstore chain, it said in a statement.

Dairy Farm already operates 100 stores in Hong Kong and 59 in Taiwan under the Mannings brand, and a further 54 Guardian stores in Singapore, 50 in Malaysia, one in India and now 20 in Indonesia, it said.
